page.description: Shortcut keys allow access to menu commands with a single keystroke. The following shortcut keys assist you in viewing, entering, and changing data in Forms and Browses:

item.name: F6
item.description: Move to the next region on a Form

item.name: CTRL N
item.description: Selects New from the File menu

item.name: CTRL S
item.description: Selects Save from the File menu

item.name: ALT BACKSPACE
item.description: Selects Undo from the Edit menu

item.name: CTRL SHIFT F
item.description: Copy field value of last viewed record into the current record

item.name: CTRL N
item.description: Inspect memo in the Memo Editor

item.name: CTRL O
item.description: Selects Open from the File menu

item.name: CTRL P
item.description: Selects Print from the File menu

item.name: CTRL SHIFT R
item.description: Copy all field values from the last viewed record into the current record

item.name: CTRL ENTER
item.description: During data entry, saves the current record and begins entering a new record.

section.title: Entering Date and Time Values
section.description: When either a forms or browse is visible, selecting Edit > Insert > Date or Edit > Insert > Time will insert the date or time into the current field. When using the keyboard shortcut, Control+Shift+T, to insert a time stamp into a field, you can change the time stamp format using the Settings dialog box. Select View > Settings > Preferences > Time Format > Time Stamp Format. See the TIME() function for information on the syntax of the time format string.
section.note: To create a time format string interactively, go to the Interactive window and type "time(". Alpha Anywhere will prompt for the "time_format". Right-click and a genie will appear.
